title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3 ยง 5.2 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3 ยง 5.2 - Definitions

State Regulations

For purposes of this Part: (a) The term foreign bank office means a
branch or an agency of a foreign banking corporation licensed by the
superintendent to conduct a banking business in New York. (b) The term GAAP means United States
generally accepted accounting principles. (c) The term GAAS means United States
generally accepted auditing standards. (d) The term ROC-A examination rating means
the examination rating system for a foreign bank office conducting a banking
business in the United States, in which the term ROC-A stands for risk
management, operational controls, compliance, and asset quality. (e) The term independent external auditor
means an independent public accountant registered or licensed to practice as a
public accountant in New York State. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3
ยง
5.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
